newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian police destroy huge drug laboratory.
newsitem.headline: Colombian police destroy huge drug laboratory.

text.p: Anti-narcotics police destroyed a huge drug laboratory and seized more than 2,300 pounds (1,050 kg) of cocaine in a raid early on Sunday in Colombia's eastern Vichada province, authorities said.

Col. Leonardo Gallego, chief of the anti-narcotics division of the National Police, said vast quantities of precursor chemicals used for processing cocaine were also seized in the raid on the clandestine drug lab.
Workers at the lab, which was nestled in a jungle-covered area and built to house at least 60 people, fled as police swooped down on it by helicopter, Gallego said.
The lab, which Gallego described as having "a very high production capacity," was the second major drug factory destroyed by police in less than a week.
Last Thursday, in southeastern Vaupes province, police destroyed a facility with the capacity to produce more than 2,200 pounds (1,000 kg) of cocaine a day.
